title1: full of high spirits and fune.g: Neil was feeling playful at his birthday party.
title2: consoling, compassionatee.g: The nurse was comforting the wounded soldier.
title3: exasperated, annoyede.g: Frances was irritated by all the junk mail she received.
title4: Bored

title1: alarmed, fearfule.g: The boy was terrified when he thought he saw a ghost.
title2: agitated, worried, uneasye.g: The man was very upset when his mother died.
title3: conceited, self-important, having a big opinion of oneself e.g: The arrogant man thought he knew more about politics than everyone else in the room.
title4: irritated, displeasede.g: Jack was annoyed when he found out he had missed the last bus home.

title1: being funny, playfule.g: Gary was always joking with his friends.
title2: confused, nervous and upsete.g: Sarah felt a bit flustered when she realised how late she was for the meeting and that she had forgotten an important document.
title3: passion, lust, longing fore.g: Kate had a strong desire for chocolate.
title4: certain, absolutely positivee.g: Richard was convinced he had come to the right decision.

title1: being funny, playfule.g: Gary was always joking with his friends.
title2: demanding, persisting, maintaininge.g: After a work outing, Frank was insisting he paid the bill for everyone.
title3: finding something funnye.g: I was amused by a funny joke someone told me.

title1: exasperated, annoyede.g: Frances was irritated by all the junk mail she received.
title2: cynical, mocking, scornfule.g: The comedian made a sarcastic comment when someone came into the theatre late.
title3: anxious, fretful, troublede.g: When her cat went missing, the girl was very worried.
title4: sociable, amiablee.g: The friendly girl showed the tourists the way to the town centre.

title1: horrified, astonished, alarmede.g: Jane was aghast when she discovered her house had been burgled.
title2: daydreaminge.g: Emma was fantasizing about being a film star.

title4: fearful, worried, filled with anxietye.g: Claire was alarmed when she thought she was being followed home.

title4: glum, miserable, lowe.g: Adam was dispirited when he failed his exams.
